intro: Galium × baumgartneri, commonly known as the Baumann's bedstraw, is a hybrid species within the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers in clusters, typically blooming in early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and habitat restoration.
